About

My name is Sebastian T. Vincent. I am currently a PhD student at the University of Sheffield, working on Personalising Document-level Machine Translation for Dialogue under the supervision of Carolina Scarton and Loic Barrault .

I originally come from Poland, where I went to the 14th High School in Wroclaw, studying for a Maths and Computer Science with the focus on algorithmic problem solving. In 2016 I started studying for the BSc Artificial Intelligence and Computer Science degree at the University of Sheffield. Having graduated in 2019, I am now part of the first cohort of the Speech and Language Technologies and their Applications CDT in Sheffield. In my spare time, I teach privately University-level Computer Science content.

In my spare time I am committed to calisthenics and movement practice. I also enjoy reading philosophy books and playing board games.

Research Interests

Among my research interests are: Document-level Machine Translation, Natural Language Understanding and Controlled Natural Language Generation. In my thesis I aim to improve Machine Translation of dialogue by considering document cohesion as well as the impact of the extra-textual context on the meaning of the source text.
